results.title: Wild weather
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, TLC Films and Will Aslett
results.brief_description: Wild weather is proof that the Earth and its weather can be made into an interesting and fun documentary series. The effervescent presenter Donal MacIntyre is an adventurer and extreme sports fan who takes us on a journey around the world to discover how the weather works - from a gentle breeze to an extreme tornado. Admittedly most of the action takes place in the Northern Hemisphere but it is well made television with 3D computer animation aiding the storytelling. “Wind” shows the way wind is created around the Earth. “Wet” shows how rain is made and can reach the extremes of killer storms. “Cold” deals with snow and glaciers and “Heat” looks at deserts and lightning.

results.title: Wild target
results.creator_credit: Sharmill Films, Philippe Martin and Pierre Salvadori
results.brief_description: This is a winning black farce and a wistful romantic comedy. Starring seasoned veteran Jean Rochefort as a grave-faced professional hitman who guided by his mother in the family business has reached the pinnacle of his career. He is a control freak and self-improver, meticulous at work and at home and a confirmed bachelor and erstwhile linguist. Hard at work one day he runs into a young man (played by Guillaume Diepardieu) who becomes his reluctant apprentice with hilarious results. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Wild swans
results.creator_credit: Scorer Associates, BBC-TV, Anne Scorer and Mischa Scorer
results.brief_description: Based on the critically acclaimed account of the lives of three Chinese women spanning three generations. The book “Wild Swans” has been a best seller world-wide except in China where a Government ban prevents its publication or distribution. The book was conceived when Jung Chang’s mother visited Britain in 1990 and provided her with a detailed account of the family history. The film recreates this period of discussion and recollection between mother and daughter, interwoven with archival and contemporary Chinese film and photographs and readings by the author from her book. “Wild Swans” conveys both the extraordinary personal qualities of the author and how ordinary lives are shaped by historical forces.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scorer Associates, BBC-TV, Anne Scorer and Mischa Scorer

results.title: Wild Stallion Mountain – The Bombay Royale
results.brief_description: Melbourne band The Bombay Royale make “vintage Bollywood-inspired surf, spy, disco and funk” and their video for Wild Stallion Mountain (2015) clearly reflects that, playing like a mash-up of Bollywood, 60s psychedelia, kitsch, exploitation cinema and classic Hollywood Westerns.

constellations_primary.name: Wild Stallion Mountain: Genre Mash-ups
constellations_primary.description: The Bombay Royale are known for combining funk, disco and pop with the sounds of classical Indian music together with the soundtracks of Bollywood cinema. Their music videos similarly hybridise  genres and styles to create intoxicating visual mash-ups.

results.description: Wearing their influences firmly on their sleeve, Melbourne band The Bombay Royale make “vintage Bollywood-inspired surf, spy, disco and funk” and their video for ‘Wild Stallion Mountain’ (2015) clearly reflects that. With both their sound and style linked very closely to movies, the music clip plays like a visual mash-up of their various inspirations including Bollywood, 60s psychedelia, the kitsch, exploitation cinema and classic Hollywood Westerns.

results.title: Wild September snow
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and John King
results.brief_description: A New Zealand tourist film of ski-instructors chasing two winters around the world. Shows various ski areas in the North Island, glimpses of ski villages, the Southern Alps and some spectacular scenery and skiing.

results.title: Wild science
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Sheldon Fay Jr and Chuck Barbee
results.brief_description: Actor Peter Falk talks of science’s newest and most controversial frontier: phenomena that seem to exist, yet cannot be tested or explained by scientific method.

results.title: Wild life refuge
results.brief_description: Describes the four major routes in the United States. Emphasises the importance of a practical programme for conserving wild fowl, the role of refuges, provision of food and water and treatment of migrating ducks, geese, and other species, shown in spring and autumn at the Klamath Basin, a typical national refuge.

results.title: Wild life paradise
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, Tourist Development Authority of Victoria, Andrew J. Helgeson and William M. Carty
results.brief_description: Sir Colin Mackenzie, famous surgeon and anatomist, thought that the study of Australia’s unique animals would help to understand the human body. He designed and made an arm splint after studying koalas stretching for gum tips. His specimens can be seen in the Institute of Anatomy in Canberra. In 1921, 78 acres of land in Healseville, Victoria, was presented to the late Sir Colin Mackenzie, to enable him to study Australian animals. The Sanctuary now shelters kangaroos, emus, platypus, goannas, many kinds of parrots, parakeets and other birds, tiger cats, wombats and koalas. Narrated by James Dibble. Suitable for 11-15 year-olds.
